result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Kenneth Schultz

defendant.name: Schultz, Kyle Kenneth

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz not in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Kyle Kenneth Schultz.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson appeared by video for Kyle Kenneth Schultz.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court in person prior to the case being called on the record, defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson is newly appointed and needs time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has received a letter stating the defendant is eligible for SPD representation but one has not been appointed yet.  Matter remains calendared for preliminary hearing in the prelim court on 7/25/2022 at 8:30 am.
dated 7/15/2022 No Conflict Letter from SPD, received and filed

Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Per SPD the client provided additional information and he has been deemed ineligible. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz not in court, defendant in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court goes off the record for SPD Heather Johnson friend of the court to interview defendant for qualification of appointment of SPD. SPD Johnson informed the court defendant does qualify for SPD representation and Atty will be appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility on 6/24/22 at 8:30 am

Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for preliminary hearing .States witness is present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with Great Apple Restaurant, Lai J. L, Kontong L., Mobil - 3061 S 108 St, Sukhraj S., Shahbaz A., Shang R. H., Abegail D M., Ngoc N. T., Aiden T W. & MJ Salon
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Kyle Kenneth Schultz in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle Kenneth Schultz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
